headline: What you don't know about lithium-ion batteries could kill you
summary: Found in everything from phones to tablets to computers to e-bikes to cordless tools, shavers and toothbrushes, lithium-ion batteries now power literally billions of personal items that are found throughout the average home. Despite their popularity, a recent study by Erie Insurance found that nearly one-quarter (23%) of respondents had no idea what lithium-ion batteries are, and nearly 70% had little-to-no concerns about their serious safety risks.

content.title: What you don't know about lithium-ion batteries could kill you
content.summary: Found in everything from phones to tablets to computers to e-bikes to cordless tools, shavers and toothbrushes, lithium-ion batteries now power literally billions of personal items that are found throughout the average home. Despite their popularity, a recent study by Erie Insurance found that nearly one-quarter (23%) of respondents had no idea what lithium-ion batteries are, and nearly 70% had little-to-no concerns about their serious safety risks.

thumbnail.caption: New Erie Insurance survey shows consumers underestimate the dangers of lithium-ion batteries; nearly 70% of Americans are not concerned or have not given any thought to the many risks
